Posts.Content: BLC wrote: I'm newly diagnosed with Breast Cancer and would like to obtain some support and encouragement.  I'm 47 years old and had a surgical biopsy last week that came back positive.  I saw a breast surgeon immediately afterward.  She informed me that I had Grade 3 aggressive and invasive cancer in my right breast.  Stated it was at least Stage 2, possibly higher.  I am having a full body screening PET CT and MRI done next week w/ ultrasound and biopsy of lymph nodes.  The surgeon recommended a masectomy with chemotherapy/radiation therapy and breast reconstruction.  I left her office with my head spinning.  I don't feel sick at all.  I am a single mom with teen aged children.  My first priority is taking care of them.  I don't want to let them down.  I did not yet tell my family with the exception of one sister.  I want to have all of the other tests completed and know my exact plan of action before I break the news to family members.  Can anyone tell me what my prognosis is and what I can expect?  I don't want to lose my job because it is all I have to financially care for my children.  Thanks in advance for your support. Posts.Content: Jul 26, 2010 07:19PM BLC wrote: I definitely made the right decision becoming a member of the Breast Cancer Org.  Ladies, thank you for sharing your knowledge and experiences.  I know that I have a tough road ahead of me, but am very optimistic and encouraged by all of the responses you posted.  Thanks for being so candid and informative, and most especially for caring. You are very special people.  I am grateful to have your support.  Thank you.
